channel.title: Mirror screen protectors
channel.description:
Anyone else have them for their phone/ipod/etc? If not, get one.
[img]http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/41dN73TKpdL.jpg[/img]
I paid $1 for 3 of them on Ebay for my Motorola Droid (free shipping etc).
They work absolutely perfectly, except the ones I got were cut a little short (expected for $1). They don't interfere with the touch screen at all, and the only draw back is that they make the screen harder to see in sunlight, and I got used to that pretty fast.

item.title: Mirror screen protectors
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I got the two protectors in the mail, put them on mine and my wife’s phones and we really like them. They are 1/8 of an inch too short, but it really doesn’t make a difference.

Because the balls are inert.

Read full topic

item.title: Mirror screen protectors
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

I had my step dad order it off ebay, so I’m not sure exactly which one it was, but this looks close:
http://cgi.ebay.com/Mirror-Screen-Protector-Motorola-VERIZON-DROID-A855-/320621809453?pt=PDA_Accessories&hash=item4aa68c8f2d (Ya, they come from Hong Kong, so shipping takes forever).

~$1.50 from Chicago, http://cgi.ebay.com/MOTOROLA-DROID-A855-MIRROR-SCREEN-PROTECTOR-/230553180017?pt=PDA_Accessories&hash=item35ae0a5771
